description:
Since Roe v. Wade was overturned, state laws on abortion have been changing constantly. It will all be part of the picture as voters go to the polls in November.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org. Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: The states where abortion is on the ballot in November

description: The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court has announced he will seek arrest warrants for leaders of Hamas and of Israel for war crimes in Gaza. The U.S. has denounced the possible prosecution of Israeli leaders. We get response from a minister in Israel's government.
title: How Does Israel Respond to the International Criminal Court?

description: Jenny Erpenbeck's novel, translated by Michael Hofmann, follows a couple in 1980s East Berlin and their tumultuous relationship, while Germany undergoes its own political transformation.
title: A German novel about a tortured love affair wins 2024 International Booker Prize

description: At 80 miles across, Thwaites is the world's widest glacier. It has been nicknamed the "Doomsday Glacier" for the catastrophic effects its thawing could have on global sea-level rise.
title: New research on Antarctica's Thwaites Glacier could reshape sea-level rise predictions

description: Almost 40 percent of caregivers of older adults are men, and a third of that group is Black. But African American men face some issues other guys don't.
title: Black men are a hidden segment of caregivers. It's stressful but rewarding, too

description: The video adds to a long line of connections between the former president and antisemitism.
title: Trump posted a video on Truth Social calling the country a 'unified reich' if he wins

description: The defense for former President Donald Trump has rested in the case, marking the end of witness testimony and paving the way for jury deliberation. The jury  could begin deliberating next Wednesday.
title: Trump won't testify in his New York hush money trial

description: President Biden called an arrest warrant request for Israeli leaders "outrageous."  Target is lowering prices on 5,000 common products.
title: Biden decries ICC arrest warrant request for Israeli leaders; Target cuts prices

description: A man from Michigan was evacuated from a cruise ship after having seizures. First, he drained his bank account to pay his medical bills.
title: He fell ill on a cruise. Before he boarded the rescue boat, they handed him the bill

description: Wisconsin is one of a handful of pivotal states in the 2024 presidential election. Within the swing state, there are swing counties that could decide the election — even as people remain divided.
title: One voted Biden. One picked Trump. It's a tale of two counties in pivotal Wisconsin

description: Activists who describe themselves as "abortion abolitionists" want to charge women who have abortions with homicide and ban the fertility treatment known as IVF, saying life begins at conception.
title: Republicans try to soften stance on abortion as 'abolitionists' go farther

description: Mourners in black began gathering Tuesday for days of funerals and processions for Iran's late president, foreign minister and others killed in a helicopter crash.
title: Mourners begin funerals for Iran's president and others killed in helicopter crash

description: Target said it is trying to help customers save money as well as stay competitive in its markets. Price reductions have already been reflected in about 1,500 products.
title: Target is reducing prices on 5,000 common goods, including milk, butter and pet food
